docs.lead_paragraph: Spain's ruling conservative party has lost the lead to the opposition Socialists, an opinion poll showed on Sunday, as its popularity declines in the wake of austerity measures, corruption scandals and a move to restrict abortion.

headline.main: Spain's Opposition Socialists Take Opinion-Poll Lead
headline.print_headline: Spain's Opposition Socialists Take Opinion-Poll Lead

docs.snippet: Spain's ruling conservative party has lost the lead to the opposition Socialists, an opinion poll showed on Sunday, as its popularity declines in the wake of austerity measures, corruption scandals and a move to restrict abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eleanor McCullen clutches a baby's hat knit in pink and blue as she patrols a yellow semicircle painted on the sidewalk outside a Planned Parenthood health clinic on a frigid December morning with snow in the forecast.

headline.main: High Court Case: Abortion Clinic Protest-Free Zone
headline.print_headline: High Court Case: Abortion Clinic Protest-Free Zone

docs.lead_paragraph: Dealing with the decline of the traditional family and high single-parent birthrates means addressing broader issues.
docs.abstract: Charles M Blow Op-Ed column holds that in confronting the decline of the traditional family and high rate of single-parent birthrates, Americans must discard puritanical impulses about sex in favor of a practical approach to sex education.
docs.snippet: Dealing with the decline of the traditional family and high single-parent birthrates means addressing broader issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: EDITOR'S NOTE — On Jan. 11, 1964, AP Science Writer Frank Carey covered the release of U.S. Surgeon General Luther Terry's historic report linking cigarette smoking to lung cancer. The report has been called one of the most important documents in U.S. public health history. While not the first to raise the alarm about smoking, it gave momentum to the push for tobacco controls. The surgeon general has periodically issued more smoking reports, and a new one is due out next week. Fifty years after its original publication, the AP is making this story available to its subscribers.

headline.main: AP WAS THERE: '64 US Report Ties Smoking to Cancer
headline.print_headline: AP WAS THERE: '64 US Report Ties Smoking to Cancer

docs.snippet: EDITOR'S NOTE — On Jan. 11, 1964, AP Science Writer Frank Carey covered the release of U.S. Surgeon General Luther Terry's historic report linking cigarette smoking to lung cancer. The report has been called one of the most important documents...

docs.lead_paragraph: The wife of a Palestinian prisoner in an Israeli jail gave birth on Friday to a boy born from sperm smuggled into Gaza, her family said, the first successful pregnancy of its kind in the embattled coastal enclave.

headline.main: Smuggled Sperm Brings Baby Joy to Gaza Prisoner's Family
headline.print_headline: Smuggled Sperm Brings Baby Joy to Gaza Prisoner's Family

docs.snippet: The wife of a Palestinian prisoner in an Israeli jail gave birth on Friday to a boy born from sperm smuggled into Gaza, her family said, the first successful pregnancy of its kind in the embattled coastal enclave.

docs.lead_paragraph: In addition to her daughter, Bridgett Webb cares for her niece, who has contended with depression and developmental delays, and the niece’s four children.

headline.main: Taking Responsibility for a Child, Then Raising Five More
headline.print_headline: Taking Responsibility for a Child, Then Raising Five More

docs.abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York gives Bridgett Webb of the Bronx $361 to buy school uniforms required for her niece's twin daughters; Webb cares for her own daughter, her niece, and her niece’s four children.
docs.snippet: In addition to her daughter, Bridgett Webb cares for her niece, who has contended with depression and developmental delays, and the niece’s four children.

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Public Library is evolving from a place where people can check out books and surf the Web to one where residents can also earn an accredited high school diploma.

headline.main: Los Angeles Library to Offer High School Diplomas
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Library to Offer High School Diplomas

docs.snippet: The Los Angeles Public Library is evolving from a place where people can check out books and surf the Web to one where residents can also earn an accredited high school diploma.

docs.lead_paragraph: When her mind is clear, Gong Qifeng can recall how she begged for mercy. Several people pinned her head, arms, knees and ankles to a hospital bed before driving a syringe of labor-inducing drugs into her stomach.

headline.main: Forced Abortions Highlight Abuses in China Policy
headline.print_headline: Forced Abortions Highlight Abuses in China Policy

docs.snippet: When her mind is clear, Gong Qifeng can recall how she begged for mercy. Several people pinned her head, arms, knees and ankles to a hospital bed before driving a syringe of labor-inducing drugs into her stomach.

docs.lead_paragraph: It takes a lot more than a cake and a song to celebrate a baby's first birthday in South Korea, where in the past disease and starvation claimed so many lives that the completion of an infant's first year was a major milestone.

headline.main: At One Year, South Korean Babies Get Gilded Parties
headline.print_headline: At One Year, South Korean Babies Get Gilded Parties

docs.snippet: It takes a lot more than a cake and a song to celebrate a baby's first birthday in South Korea, where in the past disease and starvation claimed so many lives that the completion of an infant's first year was a major milestone.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 58-year-old Utah woman is set to give birth in a few weeks — to her first grandchild.
